    • rotate

      public void rotate​(double lat, double lon, boolean inDegrees)
      Rotate all the vertices of this solid such that vertex(0) resides at location specified by lat, lon.
      Parameters:
      lat - latitude
      lon - longitude
      inDegrees - if true, lat,lon are in degrees, otherwise radians.

      Rotate all the vertices of this solid by the specified euler rotation angles.
      Parameters:
      eulerRotationAngles - 3-element array with rotation angles in radians.

    • getNVertices

      public int getNVertices()
      Retrieve the number of verteces that define the polyhedron: 4 for tetrahedron, 8 for cube, 6 for octahedron, 12 for icosahedron and 20 for dodecahedron.
      Returns:
      int

    • getNFaces

      public int getNFaces()
      Retrieve the number of faces that define the polyhedron: 4 for tetrahedron, 6 for cube, 8 for octahedron, 20 for icosahedron and 12 for dodecahedron.
      Returns:
      int

    • getNVerticesPerFace

      public int getNVerticesPerFace()
      Retrieve the number of verteces that define each face of the polyhedron: 3 for tetrahedron, 4 for cube, 3 for octahedron, 3 for icosahedron and 5 for dodecahedron.
      Returns:
      int

    • getVertices

      public double[][] getVertices()
      Retrieve and array of unit vectors, one for each vertex of the polyhedron.
      Returns:
      double[][]

    • getVertex

      public double[] getVertex​(int i, int j)
      Get the unit vector of the vertex that is the j'th vertex of the i'th face of the polyhedron. i ranges from 0 to nFaces and j ranges from 0 to nVertecesPerFace.
      Parameters:
      i - int
      j - int
      Returns:
      double[]

    • getFaces

      public int[][] getFaces()
      Retrieve the connectivity map for all the faces of the polyhedron.
      Returns:
      int[][] nFaces by nVerticesPerFace array of integers where the integers are the index of the vertex.

    • getFace

      public int[] getFace​(int i)
      Retrieve the connectivity of the i'th face fo the polyhedron.
      Parameters:
      i - int the index of the face for which the connectivity is desired.
      Returns:
      int[] the indeces of the verteces that comprise the i'th face. The length will be 3 for tetrahedron, 4 for cube, 3 for octahedron, 3 for icosahedron and 5 for dodecahedron.

    • getEdgeLength

      public double getEdgeLength​(int nSubdivisions)
      Retrieve the length of the first edge of the first face of the solid, in radians.
      Parameters:
      nSubdivisions - number of times actual edgelength should be divided in half.
      Returns:
      the length of the first edge of the first face of the solid, in radians.

    • getEdgeLengthDegrees

      public double getEdgeLengthDegrees​(int nSubdivisions)
      Retrieve the length of the first edge of the first face of the solid, in degrees.
      Parameters:
      nSubdivisions - number of times actual edgelength should be divided in half.
      Returns:
      the length of the first edge of the first face of the solid, in degrees.
